description: Authorities set on a worldwide chase to find Nicholas Alahverdian, once praised for his work as a child advocate, who has been accused of rape, abuse and fraud.
title: He faked his own death in 2020. A trail of rape and fraud allegations finally caught up to him.

description: The annual Geminid meteor shower is set to peak overnight Friday and into the early hours of Saturday.
title: Geminid meteor shower, one of the year's best and most reliable, to peak Friday night

description: A person in Louisiana is hospitalized with what may be the state’s first case of bird flu, state health officials said Friday.
title: Patient hospitalized with possible bird flu infection in Louisiana

description: President-elect Donald Trump on Friday said he and Republicans would seek to permanently eliminate daylight saving time when he takes office.
title: Trump says he will seek to eliminate daylight saving time

description: The former Indiana University basketball team doctor accused of sexually assaulting players back in the 1990s invoked his Fifth Amendment right against self-incrimination dozens of times during a recent deposition when he was asked whether he performed rectal examinations on young athletes, according to the transcript of his testimony.
title: Doctor accused of abusing Indiana University athletes invokes Fifth Amendment in deposition

description: Lawyers for Donald Trump called prosecutors' suggestion that he be treated like a defendant who's died a "dark dream scenario" and "irresponsible," while again urging a New York judge to make the hush money conviction against their client go away.
title: Trump urges judge to dismiss hush money case, blasting DA's death analogy as 'unhinged'

description: The Supreme Court on Friday agreed to hear a case about whether a charitable group linked with the Catholic Church can claim a religious exemption from Wisconsin’s unemployment tax system.
title: Supreme Court to weigh Catholic Church-affiliated charitable group's bid for religious tax exemption

description: An Arizona man was arrested this week for allegedly producing child sex abuse materials, in which he coerced minors to self-mutilate, as part of his efforts with online terror groups, federal prosecutors said.
title: Arizona man accused of making child mutilation videos for online terror groups, feds say

description: President-elect Donald Trump may spend part of the week before Christmas being grilled by lawyers in his defamation case against ABC News.
title: Trump may be deposed next week in his defamation case against ABC News

description: Attorneys for "Vanderpump Rules" star James Kennedy said there were no injuries in the incident that led to his arrest on suspicion of misdemeanor domestic violence earlier this week.
title: James Kennedy lawyers say 'no injuries' in 'Vanderpump Rules' star's domestic violence arrest

description: A handful of U.S. colleges and universities have been cautioning their international student bodies to return to campus early to avoid any travel delays.
title: Schools caution international students: Get back to campus before Trump's inauguration

description: Stepping into a legal fight that has been raging for years, the Supreme Court said it would decide whether California can set its own, often strict vehicle emissions standards that include curbs on greenhouse gases.
title: Supreme Court to consider industry groups' bid to challenge California power to set vehicle emissions

description: Obesity dipped in U.S. adults last year for the first time in more than a decade, research found. That might be due, in part, to weight loss drugs like Ozempic.
title: Obesity dipped in U.S. adults last year for the first time in more than a decade

description: The exotic dancer who once accused three Duke University lacrosse of raping her admitted this week that she invented the 2006 allegations that set off a combustible national conversation about gender, race and class. Crystal Mangum, who is now in prison serving time for second-degree murder, said she "made up a story that wasn't true" against one-time defendants David Evans, Collin Finnerty and Reade Seligmann who "didn't deserve that."
title: Woman who accused Duke lacrosse players of rape in 2006 now admits she lied

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s national security team has held discussions with the White House and Ukrainian leaders as part of a concerted effort to find a way to end the war with Russia, multiple sources with knowledge of the matter told NBC News.
title: Trump team in talks with Biden and Ukrainian officials about ending war with Russia

description: The hundreds of mysterious New Jersey drone sightings are sparking mounting demands for a more forceful federal response, calls that come as even more sightings are being reported in New York, Pennsylvania and Maryland.
title: Drone sightings spread beyond New Jersey as officials express outrage over federal response

description: Miguel Cardona, from 4th grade teacher to Education Secretary, defends federal agency amid Trump’s push to eliminate it, emphasizing its role in public school oversight.
title: Outgoing Education Sec. warns of coming 'dark era' with Trump's vow to eliminate the department

description: DAMASCUS, Syria — Cockroaches crawled out of the walls near a dirty, stained sink in the Syrian prison cell where an ex-prisoner told NBC News that American journalist Austin Tice was once held.
title: New information discovered in search for American missing in Syria

description: An incoming West Virginia state lawmaker was arrested Thursday after he allegedly threatened to kill other state lawmakers.
title: Incoming West Virginia state lawmaker arrested after allegedly threatening to kill fellow lawmakers

description: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., was admitted to the hospital in Luxembourg after sustaining an injury while on a congressional delegation trip to mark the 80th anniversary of the Battle of the Bulge. NBC News' Sahil Kapur reports on the former speaker's condition.
title: Nancy Pelosi hospitalized during congressional visit to Luxembourg

description: The sister of Hannah Kobayashi, the Hawaii woman who was at the center of a Southern California missing persons investigation, posted an update to the family's GoFundMe page on Thursday offering refunds to people who donated.
title: Hannah Kobayashi family offers refunds to those donating to search efforts now that she's found

description: The ex-wife of a prominent Los Angeles doctor who was gunned down in an ambush-style attack outside his clinic was among five people arrested and charged in his murder.
title: Ex-wife of Los Angeles doctor killed in 'ambush-style attack' is among 5 people arrested

description: McKinsey & Company agreed to pay $650 million in a deferred prosecution agreement that will resolve a federal criminal probe into the company’s consulting work advising Purdue Pharma on how to increase sales of its opioid painkiller OxyContin, a court filing said Friday.
title: McKinsey & Co. to pay $650M to settle opioid consulting probe, ex-partner to plead guilty

description: San Francisco 49ers linebacker De'Vondre Campbell left the sidelines during his team's season-crushing loss to the Los Angeles Rams on Thursday night, in an apparent refusal to play that earned scorn from teammates.
title: 49ers linebacker De'Vondre Campbell refused to play against Rams, a move blasted by teammates

description: Daniel Penny, the man who was found not guilty in the chokehold death of Jordan Neely, will be the personal guest of Vice President-elect JD Vance at the Army-Navy game.
title: Daniel Penny to be JD Vance's guest at this weekend's Army-Navy game

description: One of two suspects has been arrested in connection with a home invasion in Pennsylvania earlier this month that left a 25-year-old man dead and his mother paralyzed after being shot multiple times.
title: Suspect arrested and one wanted in Pa. home invasion that left man dead and woman paralyzed

description: Broncos vs. Colts isn't the most exciting NFL game. But the outcome could shape the playoff picture.
title: The under-the-radar NFL matchup that could reshape the playoff bracket

description: Detectives from the Scottsdale Police Department and Secret Service agents arrested a man suspected to be involved in an alleged cryptocurrency fraud scheme. Nuruhussein Hussein was booked into Maricopa County jail for multiple felony charges, including theft, fraud schemes and money laundering.
title: Fake Uber driver in Arizona accused of stealing cryptocurrency

description: Mysterious drones have been spotted buzzing over neighborhoods, businesses, and military bases across the U.S., with sightings now expanding from New Jersey to Maryland. Now, a group of lawmakers on Capitol Hill have sent a letter to several federal agencies demanding answers and transparency. NBC’s Sam Brock reports for TODAY.
title: Mysterious drone sightings in New Jersey spread to Maryland

description: U.S. officials are now in Syria and pushing for a peaceful transition after the fall of the Assad regime. It comes as the discovery of an American freed from a Syrian prison raises hopes that other Americans held there could be found, including journalist Austin Tice. NBC’s Richard Engel reports for TODAY.
title: Search for missing American journalist Austin Tice goes on in Syria

description: NYPD investigators believe they have a clearer picture of how Luigi Mangione, the suspect in the UnitedHealthcare CEO’s murder, evaded authorities for nearly a week and traveled from New York to Pennsylvania completely undetected. Meanwhile, officials have confirmed Mangione was not insured by UnitedHealthcare. NBC’s Stephanie Gosk reports for TODAY.
title: Police share new details in Luigi Mangione's escape from New York

description: The White House said drones flying over New Jersey and New York don’t pose a public threat, but lawmakers still want more answers.
title: Questions about drone sightings and new findings about human evolution: Morning Rundown

description: Millions are bundling up across the country with temperatures plunging from the Midwest to New England and the wind chill dipping far below zero in some areas. NBC’s Emilie Ikeda reports and TODAY’s Al Roker tracks the forecast.
title: Cold snap brings freezing temperatures to Midwest and Northeast

description: Police have arrested a fake Uber driver who is accusing of stealing more than $300,000 in cryptocurrency from unwitting passengers.
title: Fake Uber driver made $300,000 stealing customers' cryptocurrency, police say

description: Marjorie Fiterman and Bernie Littman are officially the world’s oldest newlyweds, with a combined age of 202.
title: Spouses with combined age of 202 become world’s oldest newlyweds

description: A "magazine disconnect" on handguns can help prevent accidental shootings, but the gun industry has opposed efforts to mandate it.
title: A simple device could help curb accidental gun deaths, but most firearms don’t have it

description: Israel ordered troops to prepare to spend winter on Mount Hermon in the Syria buffer zone after the Assad regime's collapse. And a post office in Nuseirat refugee camp was hit by the IDF, killing dozens according to local health officials.
title: Israel orders troops to remain in Syria buffer zone through winter

description: The Internet Archive has been working to make early sound recording accessible online through their "Great 78" project. Now, they are facing a lawsuit from major record labels. NBC News' Ellison Barber has more on what is in the suit.
title: Record archive nonprofit facing lawsuit from music labels

description: Luigi Mangione, the suspect in the killing of UnitedHealthcare’s CEO, was not insured by the company, the overarching business that owns it said.
title: Suspect in CEO's killing was not insured by UnitedHealthcare, company says

description: The lien on Donna and Gary Lindabury's home for a 15-year-old medical debt was one of 11,500 released by Atrium Health after an NBC News report.
title: 'Like a miracle': N.C. couple free of nearly $100,000 medical debt after 15 years

description: After NBC's reporting on a large hospital system that placed liens on homes of patients who owed medical debt, the company removed the liens and canceled judgments against thousands of patients. NBC News' Christine Romans spoke with one family whose debt was removed.
title: Relief for thousands of families burdened by crushing medical debt
